Bill,

By default, Cantera flags as an error a negative A coefficient, beca=
use 
it can't easily check that there is a duplicate reaction, and that the=
 
sum is always positive. But you can tell it that it is ok by specifying 
=
the option 'negative_A' in the reaction entry in the cti file:

reaction('n=
h + no <=3D> n2o + h', [-2.16E13, -0.23, 0.0], options =3D 
['duplicate','n=
egative_A'])

The ck2cti translator does not add this option automatically,=
 but I 
suppose it could if A is negative in the Chemkin file.

Dave

Bill, 


By default, Cantera flags as an error a negative A coefficient,
be=
cause it can't easily check that there is a duplicate reaction, and
that th=
e sum is always positive. But you can tell it that it is ok by
specifying t=
he option 'negative_A' in the reaction entry in the cti
file:


reaction('n=
h + no <<=3D> n2o + h', [-2.16E13, -0.23, 0.0], options =3D
['duplicate','n=
egative_A'])


The ck2cti translator does not add this option automatically=
, but I
suppose it could if A is negative in the Chemkin file. 


Dave



O=
n Mar 3, 2005, at 9:54 AM, William Pitz wrote:


<excerpt> Dave,


 Thanks!=


 Cantera found a problem with a discontinuity in a species thermo
which i=
s very useful since as you have pointed out this can cause a
problem with t=
he solver.


 I also got the error:


<fixed>Procedure: getRateCoefficient<=
/fixed>

<fixed> Error:=A0=A0 negative or zero A coefficient for reaction 2=
538</fixed>


Actually this is ok because the rate constant is the differen=
ce of two
Arrhenius expressions:

 Chemkin file specification:


<fixed>! M=
iller & Melius, 24th Symp. on Comb., 1992.</fixed>

<fixed> nh+no=3Dn2o+h=
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 2.94E+14=A0 -0.40=A0=A0 0.000E+0=
0=A0=A0</fixed>

<fixed> DUP</fixed>

<fixed> nh+no=3Dn2o+h=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=
=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0=A0 -2.16E+13=A0 -0.23=A0=A0 0.000E+00=A0=A0</fixed>

=
<fixed> DUP</fixed>



Bill





 At 04:40 PM 3/2/2005 -0800, you wrote:


=
Bill,


 Try this:


 mec =3D importPhase('mech.cti')


 You don't need to =
convert the cti file to xml; Cantera handles that
automatically.


 Dave


=
